intro: Cissampelos vestita, commonly known as the naked stem moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by distinctive, winged fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
